title: 55 years ago, the first computer search warrant was issued in February 1971, a Santa Clara judge authorized police to seize punch cards and a 'computer memory bank'
summary: In February 1971, a Santa Clara judge issued a warrant for police to seize computer data, marking the first computer search warrant in history. The warrant allowed Oakland Police to enter offices and homes in search of data stored on machines, expanding the scope of search warrants beyond physical papers.
insight: Blurred lines between physical and digital evidence in law enforcement.

title: Hands-on: G AIM E 30th Anniversary Time Crisis Light Gun Game
summary: G AIM E's Time Crisis Light Gun Game brings the classic experience home, celebrating 30 years of Time Crisis with official licensing.
insight: Reviving a nostalgic gaming genre with modern, immersive technology.

title: MIT-developed 3D printer can output a fully functional electric motor in a single process team only needed to magnetize the linear motor after printing, motors cost just 50 cents each
summary: MIT researchers developed a 3D printer that prints functional linear motors with minimal post-processing, reducing costs to 50 cents each.
insight: Game-changing, low-cost motor production for widespread adoption and innovation.

title: Be quiet! Silent Loop 3 420 review: Performance cooling with minimal noise
summary: The Be Quiet Silent Loop 3 420 AIO outperforms many 360mm competitors with reduced noise.
insight: Exceptional performance with minimal noise makes it a great choice for PC enthusiasts.

title: Sam Altman fires back at Elon Musk's proposal for space-based data centers, says orbiting data centers 'ridiculous' for now cites high failure rates and cost as primary limiters
summary: Sam Altman criticizes Elon Musk's space-based data center proposal, citing high failure rates and costs as major limitations. Orbital data centers are deemed impractical for now. This opinion stands in contrast to those of Musk and Bezos.
insight: Orbital data centers face significant technical and financial hurdles.

title: Akasa launches its latest-generation fanless Mini-ITX case Euler CMX supports modern Intel Core Ultra processors up to 35W TDP and standard mini-ITX mobos
summary: The Akasa Euler CMX is a fanless Mini-ITX case supporting modern Intel Core Ultra processors up to 35W TDP. It is designed to work with standard mini-ITX motherboards. This case offers a compact, quiet computing solution.
insight: Enables high-performance computing in compact, quiet, and fanless designs.

title: AI energy efficiency comparisons unfair bleats Sam Altman, citing amount of energy needed to evolve, then train a human one takes like 20 years of life and all of the food you eat during that time before you get smart he argues
summary: Sam Altman claims AI energy efficiency comparisons are unfair, citing human evolution and training costs.
insight: Comparing AI to human development is a flawed energy efficiency metric.

title: Computer History Museum unveils comically large-scale rendition of the 1986 Apple Macintosh Plus 'Big Mac' celebrates 50th Apple anniversary towering all-in-one's keyboard looks disproportionately huge today
summary: The Computer History Museum is unveiling a life-sized model of the 1986 Apple Macintosh Plus 'Big Mac' to commemorate Apple's 50th anniversary. The all-in-one computer will be displayed in a way that highlights its keyboard, which may seem oversized by today's standards. The exhibit is part of the museum's Apple at 50 celebrations next month.
insight: Vintage tech design makes for eye-opening comparisons today

title: Dell's new prebuilt PC has special custom power connector for Nvidia GPU even large OEMs apparently fear the 16-pin power connector meltdowns
summary: Dell introduces a custom power connector to mitigate 16-pin overheating issues in their new prebuilt PC, featuring the RTX 5070 Ti, by using genuine Amphenol brackets to lock the connector into place.
insight: OEMs fear 16-pin connector meltdowns due to overheating risks.

title: Intel shifts customer support to AI-powered assistant after scaling back phone support Ask Intel system built on Microsoft Copilot Studio
summary: Intel has launched Ask Intel, an AI-powered support assistant built with Microsoft Copilot Studio, to provide customers with a more efficient and effective support experience. The system aims to help users quickly find solutions to their issues. This marks a shift for Intel as it scales back phone support.
insight: AI-powered support streamlines customer experience and reduces phone reliance.

title: You can log into 28 vintage computer systems in your browser for free, thanks to the Interim Computer Museum Experience legendary OSes, architectures, programming languages, and games
summary: Experience legendary operating systems, architectures, and games online for free through a new portal.
insight: Preserving digital history and nostalgia for vintage computer enthusiasts

title: Retail DDR5 memory prices slowly drop in Europe despite ongoing shortages overdue pricing correction could be beginning in some regions
summary: Retail DDR5 memory prices are slowly dropping in Europe, with some 32 GB kits seeing price reductions.
insight: Price corrections may be underway, benefiting consumers and potentially stabilizing the market.

title: Nvidia's Chinese competitor Moore Threads beats it to launching a laptop featuring custom 12-core Arm chip "MTT AI Book" can run Windows, seems to have adopted Arm before Nvidia's N1X
summary: Moore Threads has launched a laptop with a custom 12-core Arm chip, beating Nvidia's N1X. The MTT AI Book laptop features a custom GPU and NPU, and can run Windows. The device is powered by a SoC with advanced AI capabilities.
insight: Moore Threads is leading Nvidia in Arm-based laptop development efforts.

title: Colorado law could force surveillance for 3D printers to prevent use for making gun parts fourth state to propose new bans is expanding firearms laws to regulate digital files
summary: Colorado joins New York, Washington, and California in regulating 3D printed guns, expanding firearms laws to include digital files and potentially requiring surveillance of 3D printers.
insight: Regulating digital files may not stop determined gun manufacturers.

title: AMD VEK385 Versal AI Edge Gen 2 FPGA evaluation kit plugs directly into a PCIe Gen5/Gen4 slot
summary: AMD's VEK385 Versal AI Edge Gen 2 FPGA kit accelerates prototyping for various applications with its heterogeneous adaptive SoC, featuring eight Cortex-A78AE cores, ten Cortex-R52 cores, and advanced AI capabilities.
insight: Accelerates industrial, automotive, and healthcare applications with advanced AI capabilities.

title: The Ambient IoT Alliance aims to promote and develop standards for batteryless IoT devices using energy harvesting
summary: The Ambient IoT Alliance promotes standardization for batteryless IoT devices using energy harvesting, reducing costs through ambient power sources like radio waves and light.
insight: Batteryless IoT devices promise significant cost savings and high scalability.

title: OnLogic Factor 101 A fanless industrial edge AI computer with Qualcomm QCS6490 SoC, 10GbE networking
summary: The OnLogic Factor 101 is a fanless industrial computer designed for edge AI and data gateway applications with a Qualcomm QCS6490 SoC. It features 10GbE networking, 8GB LPDDR4x memory, and 128GB UFS storage. This ultra-small form factor computer targets space-constrained applications in machine vision, inspection, and monitoring.
insight: Edge AI computing meets industrial needs with high-speed networking and storage.

title: Rocket reentries are leaving measurable lithium pollution in the upper atmosphere
summary: A SpaceX Falcon 9 booster's reentry into Earth's atmosphere was captured by a lidar system, revealing measurable lithium pollution in the upper atmosphere. Researchers at the Leibniz Institute of Atmospheric Physics in Germany conducted the study. The event was observed on February 19, 2025.
insight: Lithium pollution from rocket reentries impacts Earth's upper atmosphere

title: Minecraft Java Edition is finally moving from OpenGL to multi-threaded Vulkan
summary: Minecraft Java Edition is transitioning from OpenGL to Vulkan, with updates initially released on both rendering engines to ensure a smooth transition for the modding community.
insight: Improved performance and graphics for Minecraft Java Edition users.

title: New discovery lets sodium-ion batteries store more energy while purifying water
summary: University of Surrey researchers discovered a compound, nanostructured sodium vanadate hydrate (NVOH), that can store more energy while purifying water.
insight: Heating water out won't weaken the material's stability, it's actually a key strength.

title: Asus and Acer block German users from drivers and BIOS updates after patent fallout
summary: Asus and Acer block German users from accessing drivers and BIOS updates due to patent disputes, leaving enthusiasts without support for their high-end systems.
insight: Patent fallout affects German support for high-end Asus and Acer systems.

title: Just for Fun: We Tested MSI's "RTX 5090 Ti" You Probably Can't Buy
summary: MSI's RTX 5090 Lightning Z is a limited-edition, high-performance GPU that pushes the boundaries of graphics card design, featuring exceptional thermals, power draw, and performance. We put this halo product through rigorous testing to see its capabilities. The results are a testament to the extreme end of GPU design.
insight: GPU design has limitless potential with no practical constraints applied
